page.title: 10COPLANDS BOATS,VENTNOR.
page.content: Coplands Boats was bought by John McIntosh a sailing enthusiast in 1967. The factory is built on the old Ventnor Railway Station. The first boat they built was Uffa Fox's International Flying Fifteen. They now concentrate mainly on small sailing boats and commercial workboats. All the boats are made of resin, glass fibre and a hardener and put into a polished mould. A glass fibre mat is put in to reinforce it. Sailing boats are sold in Britain but workboats go to Africa and the Middle East. The boats are taken to Cowes and put into the water. They are sailed to Southampton. If they are going abroad they are winched onto the cargo ship.
